title:
“I Can’t Breathe” - confronting but essential viewing
for all Australians
abstract:

pars:
The ABC’s investigative program Four
Corners took on a different format last
Monday night when Stan Grant presented
an intensely personal reflection on being
Indigenous in contemporary Australia. He
reveals the racist slurs he endured as a black
kid growing up in white Australia, and gives
voice to other Indigenous Australians about
their lives and the impact of George Floyd’s
murder on their own situation.

“I Can’t Breathe” is a powerful and moving
viewing experience to be recommended for
anyone who seeks a better understanding of
Aboriginal lived experience - and even more
strongly recommmended for anyone who,
like Stan Grant’s school friend, says “Why do
you have to always talk about that Abo shit?”
(This was after he had told the class about his
family background.)
“I Can’t Breathe” is available on ABC iview and at abc.net.au/4corners
